content: victoria a sweet drawstring bag by penny peberdy © updated 24 08 2010 materials 4 ply weight yarn e g paton s cotton 4ply 2 50mm hook n b all instructions are in english english notes 1 start each round with 2ch for treble rounds 3ch for the pattern round and 1ch for a double_crochet round this chain does not count as a stitch 2 end each round by slip-stitching into the first stitch of the round to join abbreviations double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half-treble treble_crochet treble dtr double-treble cross over 3 work a dtr into the 3rd st from the hook then work a treble_crochet into each of the 2 sts left behind but working the trebles behind the dtr made 1 method base 1 make a magic_ring with the yarn and into it work 12tr 2 work 2tr into each treble_crochet of prev round 24sts 3 *2tr into first treble_crochet 1tr into next treble_crochet repeat from * to end 36sts 4 repeat round 3 once more 54sts 5 work 1tr into each stitch 6 *2tr into first stitch 1tr into each of next 2 sts repeat from * to end 72sts 7 work 1dc into each stitch 8 work 1 round of treble into every double_crochet but working from the back of the work under the top of the stitch so that the chain-like top stands out around the work see pictures at end this forms a decorative edge to the base of the bag 9 *1tr into each of first 10 sts dec1 repeat from * to end 66sts 10 cross over 3 repeat to end 11 turn the work and work 1dc into each stitch note it is important to turn the work for this round or the patterns will not line up in subsequent rounds turn work again to work the cross over 3 round on the right side repeat rounds 10 and 11 six times drawstring round 3ch for height work *1dtr into first stitch 1ch miss one stitch repeat from * to end top repeat rounds 11 and 10 twice then round 11 once more edging 1ch for height *work over next 5sts as follows 1dc 1htr 1dtrg 1htr 1dc repeat from * to last st miss next st slip_stitch to join fasten_off and darn in any ends twisted cord make 2 cut 1 5m of yarn for each cord 1 double the yarn in half and put the loop end over a hook or small doorknob 2 hold the cut ends tightly and twirl in your fingers until the cord is tightly twisted along its length 3 keep tight hold of the cut ends and take off the loop end from its holder do not let go of it 4 bring the loop end to the cuts ends and hold the two together the cord should twist up on itself 5 smooth out the cord to even out the twist and knot the cut end 2 6 thread the cord through the drawstring
